thread.title: Local Rundown: Roughriders' spikers down Phoenix; win away from hosting regionals
thread.title_full: Local Rundown: Roughriders' spikers down Phoenix; win away from hosting regionals

title: Local Rundown: Roughriders' spikers down Phoenix; win away from hosting regionals
text: COLLEGE VOLLEYBALLYavapai 3, Phoenix 0 Yavapai College's volleyball team now needs only one more Arizona Conference victory in its last four regular-season matches to clinch hosting duties for the NJCAA Region I, Division I playoffs Nov. 4 and 6.The Roughriders swept D-II Phoenix College, 25-20, 25-18, 25-16, on the road Wednesday, Oct. 21, upping their record to 17-6 overall and 10-2 in the conference. Phoenix, which saw its four-match winning streak snapped, dipped to 9-13, 5-8.Iva Alebic and Shelby Mottram had nine kills apiece, and Brooke Donnelly chimed in with 14 digs to pace Yavapai, which bounced back nicely from a tough 3-2 loss at D-II Pima C.C. Oct. 16.The Roughriders will conclude the regular season with four straight league matches at Walraven Gym in Prescott.They play host to Arizona Western in back-to-back tilts at 7 p.m. Friday, Oct. 23, and 3 p.m. Saturday, Oct. 24. Yavapai will then welcome in Eastern Arizona on Wednesday, Oct. 28, and Central Arizona on Friday, Oct. 30. First serve is at 7 p.m. for both of those final two matches. PREP BADMINTONPrescott 9, North Canyon 0 The Badgers responded well from a difficult Division I, Section I loss on Tuesday, Oct. 20, with a shutout win over North Canyon in its 2015 season/section finale on Senior Night Wednesday, Oct. 21.Division I No. 8-ranked Prescott (9-2 overall record, 9-1 section) now heads to the postseason, beginning with the D-I singles and doubles tournaments at 10 a.m. Friday, Oct. 23, and 10 a.m. Saturday, Oct. 24, at Independence High in Glendale.Badgers coach Bobbi Yoder said Lauren Mazzella garnered a No. 8 seed into the singles tournament, and is her only varsity player to get a spot in the 64-player field. In state doubles, Prescott's team of Andie Gonzales and Morgan Feingold will compete. The 16-team D-I state tournament opens Monday, Oct. 26, at the sites of the top four-seeded squads. Yoder said she should know Saturday, Oct. 23, which seed Prescott will receive. PREP SWIMMINGBradshaw Mtn. swimmers roll past Dysart, Goldwater Swimming in Phoenix on Wednesday, Oct. 21, Bradshaw Mountain's boys' and girls' teams posted easy victories over host Dysart and Barry Goldwater in a tri-meet.The Bears' boys scored 150 first-place points, followed by runner-up Goldwater (58 points) and third-place Dysart (49). Bradshaw's girls tallied 161 first-place points to runner-up Goldwater's 73 and third-place Dysart's 50."All (of our) swimmers were outstanding," Bradshaw coach Patti Eller said.Bradshaw ends the 2015 regular season at 4 p.m. Tuesday, Oct. 27, when it plays host to Flagstaff and Mingus Union at the Mountain Valley Splash pool in Prescott Valley. COLLEGE SOCCERYavapai visits Glendale for make-up match Friday, Oct. 23 It's official. The Yavapai College men's soccer team will play three Arizona Conference matches in as many days, all on the road, starting at 7 p.m. Thursday, Oct. 22, at Chandler-Gilbert C.C.After Thursday, the Roughriders will visit Glendale C.C., a foe they were supposed to face Oct. 20, but will take on at 3 p.m. Friday, Oct. 23, instead, because of a rainout. The Roughriders will conclude the 2015 regular season at 6 p.m. Saturday, Oct. 24, when they battle Phoenix College.Yavapai likely needs to win all three games to have a shot at capturing the conference's regular-season crown and qualifying as a regionals host. The Region I, Division I playoffs begin with the quarterfinals on Monday, Oct. 26, continue with the semis on Wednesday, Oct. 28, and end with the title match on Saturday, Oct. 31.
